alert.note: Alert for DeSoto (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 03 at 9:43AM EDT until further notice by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... Alafia River At Lithia affecting Hillsborough County. Peace River At Arcadia at SR 70 affecting DeSoto County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Myakka River At Myakka River State Park affecting Sarasota County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Florida... Horse Creek Near Arcadia at SR 72 affecting DeSoto County. .Heavy rainfall over the last week has caused rivers to rise into Flood Stage. Most will be continuing to recede over the next few days. For the Alafia...including Lithia ...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Myakka...including Myakka River State Park...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Peace...including Zolfo Springs at SR 17, Arcadia at SR 70... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Peace River at Arcadia at SR 70. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Peace River Estates floods affecting several dozen homes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 12.9 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.9 feet on 09/22/1945. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Fri Peace River Arcadia at SR 7 11.0 10.7 Sun 8 am 12.0 12.9 12.7 12.3 11.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1045 AM EDT.
